alert.note: Alert for Southern Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Worcester, eastern Hampshire and northeastern Hampden Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 514 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over New Braintree, or 18 miles east of Amherst, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... Worcester, Shrewsbury, Westborough, Grafton, Holden, Auburn, Northborough, Clinton, Millbury, Palmer, Spencer, Leicester, Ware, Sutton, Rutland, Sterling, West Boylston, Barre, Warren and Bolton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. This storm may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for western, central and northeastern Massachusetts.
